title: Data Scientist - Generative AI
description:
Data Scientist - Generative AI-077726Description Job Location: 
Atlanta, GA
Job Description:
The Data Scientist Generative AI  Architect , you will apply expertise in data science, specifically in artificial intelligence, machine learning, and software architecture to address sophisticated business challenges.  You will own the design and implementation of advanced generative AI solutions. 
Key Responsibilities: 

Solution Design: Collaborate with clients and internal teams to understand business requirements, challenges, and opportunities. Lead the end-end tech stack assessment, architecture design for generative AI solutions (including system components, data pipelines, and deployment strategies), and integration of GenAI solution components into broader IT systems and corresponding architecture.  
Architecture Development: Develop high-level and detailed solution architectures for AI projects. Consider factors such as data integration, solution deployment, scalability, security, performance optimization, and ongoing sustainability.
Technical Expertise: Serve as the domain expert on AI technologies, including machine learning, natural language processing, computer vision, and other relevant domains. Hands-on development and delivery of GenAI solutions.
Model Selection: Evaluate and select appropriate generative AI components and algorithms based on project objectives, data characteristics, and performance requirements. Design custom models or adapt existing models to meet specific use cases.  Guide the development of vector stores, prompt engineering, performance monitoring based on solution design requirements.
Governance and Compliance: Define governance frameworks and guardrails for the ethical and responsible use of generative AI technologies.
Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and industry and company standards. 
Pre-Sales Support: Assist the sales team in pre-sales activities by providing technical expertise, participating in client meetings, and contributing to proposal development. Translate client requirements into feasible AI solutions. 

Required Skills:

10+ years professional work experience as a data scientist or on advanced analytics / statistics projects with 5+ years’ experience in one of the following sectors:  Aerospace & Defense, Automotive, Banking, Consumer Products & Retail, Financial Services, Healthcare, High Tech, Industrial Products, Insurance, Life Sciences, Manufacturing, Public Sector, Telecom, Media & Entertainment, and Energy & Utilities.
Experienced in design, development, delivery of GenAI solutions with all necessary underlying components and integration within broader IT environments.  
Master’s degree or PhD in Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, or other closely related field  
Proven experience in architecting and designing complex AI/ML systems, with a focus on generative AI technologies. Experience in Gen AI ,natural language processing (NLP) and text generation is a plus.
Understanding of AI and GenAI domains, GenAI embeddings, and theoretical aspects.
Work with RAG, vector stores, and semantic search.
Experience with multimodal models.
Strong proficiency in machine learning frameworks, libraries, and methodologies such as GPT, GANs, TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar. Experience with deep learning architectures and techniques.
Familiarity with  software architecture principles, design patterns, and system integration. Familiarity with cloud computing platforms and hyperscaler technologies (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and containerization technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
Excellent problem-solving skills and analytical thinking. Ability to analyze complex problems, propose innovative solutions, and evaluate trade-offs.
Strong communication and leadership skills. Ability to effectively communicate technical concepts to clients and non-technical stakeholders and lead cross-functional teams.  
Highly Preferred: 5+ years professional experience as and Data and AI thought leader in a large technology consulting firm. 

Life at Capgemini
Capgemini supports all aspects of your well-being throughout the changing stages of your life and career. For eligible employees, we offer: 

Flexible work 
Healthcare including dental, vision, mental health, and well-being programs
Financial well-being programs such as 401(k) and Employee Share Ownership Plan
Paid time off and paid holidays 
Paid parental leave
Family building benefits like adoption assistance, surrogacy, and cryopreservation
Social well-being benefits like subsidized back-up child/elder care and tutoring
Mentoring, coaching and learning programs
Employee Resource Groups 
Disaster Relief

About Capgemini
Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.
Get The Future You Want | www.capgemini.com

This is a general description of the Duties, Responsibilities and Qualifications required for this position. Please be aware that Capgemini may capture your image (video or screenshot) during the interview process and that image may be used for verification, including during the hiring and onboarding process.
